solution_line_template: First figure out how many city miles Carl will drive round trip by multiplying the one-way number of city miles by {round_trip_factor}: {city_miles_one_way} miles * {round_trip_factor} = <<{city_miles_one_way}*{round_trip_factor}={city_miles_round_trip}>>{city_miles_round_trip} miles

Then figure out how many highway miles Carl will drive round trip by multiplying the one-way number of highway miles by {round_trip_factor}: {highway_miles_one_way} miles * {round_trip_factor} = <<{highway_miles_one_way}*{round_trip_factor}={highway_miles_round_trip}>>{highway_miles_round_trip} miles

Now divide the round-trip number of city miles by the number of city miles per gallon Carl's car gets: {city_miles_round_trip} miles / {car_city_mpg} mpg = <<{city_miles_round_trip}/{car_city_mpg}={gallons_city}>>{gallons_city} gallons

Now divide the round-trip number of highway miles by the number of highway miles per gallon Carl's car gets: {highway_miles_round_trip} miles / {car_highway_mpg} mpg = <<{highway_miles_round_trip}/{car_highway_mpg}={gallons_highway}>>{gallons_highway} gallons

Now add the gallons for the highway miles and the city miles to find the total number of gallons Carl needs to buy: {gallons_highway} gallons + {gallons_city} gallons = <<{gallons_highway}+{gallons_city}={total_gallons_needed}>>{total_gallons_needed} gallons

Finally, multiply the number of gallons Carl needs to buy by the cost per gallon to find out how much he spends: {total_gallons_needed} gallons * ${gas_cost_per_gallon_display} = $<<{total_gallons_needed}*{gas_cost_per_gallon_value}={total_spending}>>{total_spending}
